required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Characteristics of Infective Endocarditis in East China
clinical_study.official_title: Study of the Clinical Presentations, Treatment and Outcomes of Infective Endocarditis Patients in a Tertiary Hospital in East China

lead_sponsor.agency: Second Affiliated Hospital, School of Medicine, Zhejiang University

clinical_study.source: Second Affiliated Hospital, School of Medicine, Zhejiang University

brief_summary.textblock: This was a retrospective observational study of consecutive cases of definite or possible infective endocarditis (IE) as per the modified Duke criteria between January 2008 and December 2015, which was performed at the Second Affiliated Hospital of Zhejiang University, School of medicine (SAHZU), a tertiary care referral hospital located in East China.

detailed_description.textblock: Infective endocarditis (IE) is a rare but life-threatening serious disease that still has a high mortality, even in developed countries. The objective of this study was to evaluate the clinical presentations, treatment and outcomes of IE patients in a tertiary hospital in East China over an 8-year period. This was a retrospective observational study of consecutive cases of definite or possible IE as per the modified Duke criteria between January 2008 and December 2015.

primary_outcome.measure: Complications (neurological events, systemic embolism, and congestive heart failure) of infective endocarditis
primary_outcome.time_frame: During the hospitalization, average of 1 months
primary_outcome.description: A neurological event was defined as symptomatic or asymptomatic stroke, hemorrhage, or encephalopathy. Systemic embolization was defined as an embolic event outside of the central nervous system. Congestive heart failure was defined as with class III, or IV heart failure and an ejection fraction of 40% or less.

primary_outcome.time_frame: During the hospitalization, average of 1 months
primary_outcome.description: Patients dead or moribund before discharge

arm_group.description: Patients diagnosed with definite and probable infective endocarditis defined according to the modified Duke clinical criteria during 2008-2011
Patients diagnosed with definite and probable infective endocarditis defined according to the modified Duke clinical criteria during 2012-2015

study_pop.textblock: Patients with a clinical diagnosis of infective endocarditis between January 2008 and December 2015 in a tertiary hospital located in the East China

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients with a clinical diagnosis of infective endocarditis.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients did not meet the modified Duke criteria.

overall_official.affiliation: 2nd Affiliated Hospital, School of Medicine, Zhejiang University, China
